alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 06 at 3:35AM PST until December 06 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Western Douglas County, Coos and Curry Counties, and western Josephine County, including the communities of Myrtle Point, Coquille and Scottsburg. The Southern Oregon Coast, including the communities of Gold Beach, Port Orford, Bandon, and Coos Bay. This also includes portions of Highway 101, Highway 38 and Highway 42. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Rock falls and isolated mudslides are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy rain will continue this morning as a plume of moisture remains stalled across Coos, Curry and western Douglas counties. Another 1 to 3 inches of rain is likely across a large portion of the area through this afternoon with up to 5 inches in the coastal ranges of Curry and western Josephine counties. This will lead to an increased risk of flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
